intro: Araiostegia divaricata, commonly known as the variable rock cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
